articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt, Kevin Huang
articles.description: China on Tuesday slapped tariffs on U.S. imports in a rapid response to new U.S. duties on Chinese goods, renewing a trade war between the world's top two economies as President Donald Trump sought to punish China for not halting the flow of illicit drugs.
articles.title: China hits back with tariffs on US goods after Trump imposes new levies

articles.author: Tom Balmforth, Yuliia Dysa
articles.description: After Russia's 2022 invasion, Ukraine's normally febrile political life was becalmed under martial law. But there have been growing signs of activity picking up, as the United States has set its sights on finishing the war with Russia quickly.
articles.title: Ukraine's politics warms up as US focuses on war's endgame

articles.author: Suleiman Al-Khalidi, Maya Gebeily, Khalil Ashawi
articles.description: The discussions in Ankara will include establishing Turkish airbases in central Syria and training for Syria's new army.
articles.title: Exclusive: Syria's Sharaa to discuss defense pact with Turkey's Erdogan, sources say

articles.author: Matt Spetalnick, Steve Holland
articles.description: When Benjamin Netanyahu meets U.S. President Donald Trump on Tuesday, the Israeli prime minister is expected to try to turn the page on sometimes tense relations with the Biden White House as the two leaders address the future of the Gaza ceasefire and ways to counter Iran.
articles.title: Trump and Netanyahu set for pivotal talks on Middle East agenda

articles.author: Ali Sawafta
articles.description: Thousands of Palestinians have left their homes, taking only what they could carry, after Israel told them to leave through drones with loudspeakers.
articles.title: Israeli military operation turns Jenin refugee camp into 'ghost town'

articles.author: Alkis Konstantinidis
articles.description: Hundreds of people packed a port in Santorini in the early morning hours of Tuesday to board a ferry and reach safety in Athens as a series of quakes kept shaking the famous Greek tourist island.
articles.title: Hundreds flee Santorini as quakes disrupt life

articles.author: Ju-Min Park
articles.description: A top South Korean military commander said on Tuesday he trusted President Yoon Suk Yeol to be making a legitimate decision when he declared martial law, but declined to say if the impeached leader gave orders to "drag" lawmakers out of parliament.
articles.title: South Korean military officer says he believed Yoon's martial law 'legitimate'

articles.author: Ramadan Abed, Dawoud Abu Alkas
articles.description: The Mohammed family sat up talking late into the night before their journey north to the ruins of their Gaza home, a trudge across a desolate landscape that hundreds of thousands of Palestinians embarked on last week after a ceasefire.
articles.title: A Gaza family's journey home to the ruins

articles.author: Daphne Psaledakis, Humeyra Pamuk
articles.description: Trump's overhaul of U.S. foreign assistance has led to chaos in the aid and development field, leaving hundreds of contractors in a severe financial crunch with some already having to lay off staff and others facing millions of dollars in unpaid invoices.
articles.title: USAID contractors fire staff, face cash crunch as Trump  causes chaos in aid world

articles.author: Simon Lewis
articles.description: Marco Rubio, who is on his first oversees tour as the top US diplomat, is seeking support from countries in the region for the Trump administration's attempts to deport large numbers of migrants.
articles.title: El Salvador offers to house criminals deported from the U.S. in its jails
